contents.Text: Searches directory defined in (Search Directory)
Press enter to search or click the Search Button
The Search Bar supports Boolean expressions. You can mix them as follows:
- exact match case sensitive: "search query"
- word match: 'search query'
- and (intersection): "search query1" && "search query2"
- or (union): search query1 || search query1
The search bar, by default, performs a comprehensive search that includes the 'full path' of files and folders.
This means that if you search for the letter 'A', it will return results for both songs containing that letter and folders that include it as well
The reason for this is if you search a artists name and have a folder with the artists name all songs in it recursively will be returned
Example i have a structure like this: {/British/artist_here/song1.mp3}
If i search British it will get return all songs with British in the name and all songs inside the British folder
Exclusive modern search functions:
(): Parenthesis are used to search columns in the database
Example: (length:>=1m) - That will search for all songs that are above or equal to 1 minute long
Example2: (album:Akira Yamaoka) - That will search for all songs that are tagged with the album: "Akira Yamaoka"
Here are all defined column values: (name,ext,length,artist,album.genre,language,lyrics,year,country,label,release_type,tags,rating,metadata_comments,user_notes)
For more information on tags go to[[[button:Metadata Editor][../Metadata Editor]]]
Tip: You can use AND with the parenthesis example: (term && (length:>=1m) && (length:<=3m) - That will get all songs with "Term" and their length is between 1 and 3 minutes range)
Tip2: you can use exact matching in the parenthesis example: (album:"Akira Yamaoka") - THat will use exact matching on the album name so capitals and lowercase matter
